title: I've Done the Research—These Are the Chicest Shoes to Wear With Cropped Jeans
description: Time to get those ankles out.
excerpt: Cropped jeans are one of the most popular denim styles, but there's always that one conundrum: what shoes to wear with them. Keep reading for the six styles we recommend.
text: If there's one denim trend that seems to defy the seasonal shuffle, it's cropped jeans.Whether an ankle-grazing skinny cut or a wide-leg silhouette that hovers just above the ankle, this wardrobe staple has earned a permanent spot in the fashion set's rotation. As someone who lives in cropped jeans year-round—switching between lighter washes for summer and raw hems for winter—I've come to realise that the right pair of shoes can make or break the look.The perfect shoe not only completes an outfit but sets the tone—no matter if you're aiming for effortless French-girl style or laid-back cool. And with runway shows continuing to serve us impeccable denim and shoe combinations, now feels like the right time to share which shoes truly complement cropped jeans best.Take, for example, The Row's autumn/winter 2024 show, where minimalist ballet flats were styled with slightly flared cropped denim. The juxtaposition of the typically "feminine" flat with the casual feel of cropped jeans was a standout moment that inspired me to rethink how I style my cropped jeans. Whilst I lean towards trainers for a more off-duty vibe, my fellow editors are devoted to the timeless appeal of loafers—especially when paired with cropped straight-leg jeans. From kitten heels at Miu Miu to classic pumps à la Carrie Bradshaw, certain footwear works beautifully with this hemline.Beyond aesthetics, there's also a practical element at play. Cropped jeans, by nature, frame the ankle, making them the perfect canvas for shoes that command attention. Whether you prefer sleek, polished options or something more laid-back and streetwear-inspired, the key is balance. Each shoe style lends itself to different styling possibilities; chinky trainers add a bit of an edge whilst a low heel imparts elegance.Below, I've rounded up six key shoe styles that work well with cropped jeans. There are both designer and high-street options, so there's something for everyone. You'll never have to stress over which shoes to wear with your cropped jeans again.Shop My Favourite Shoes to Wear With Cropped Jeans:1. Ballet FlatsStyle Notes: Few shoe trends have experienced as much of a revival recently as ballet flats. Thanks to fashion's obsession with quiet luxury, ballet flats are everywhere—from the streets of Paris to the Instagram feeds of the most stylish editors. Their dainty profile pairs beautifully with cropped jeans, offering a delicate touch that balances out the denim's more casual feel. Opt for pointed-toe styles for a more elevated vibe, or stick with classic round-toe versions for a true Parisian aesthetic. To avoid looking too prim, I love pairing mine with slightly distressed or frayed-hem jeans. Throw on a boxy blazer, and you're good to go.Shop Ballet Flats: The Row Awar Ballerina Flat in Leather Sleek and minimalist with a touch of elegance. Reformation Bethany Ballet Flat These popular flats are known for their comfort and timeless appeal. LE MONDE BERYL Suede Mary Jane Ballet Flats For a truly French flat, look to Le Monde Beryl. Arket Leather Ballet Flats A simple pair with a pretty twist. 2. TrainersStyle Notes: When it comes to casual style, trainers are my go-to with cropped jeans. They add a cool, effortless feel and work well whether you're running errands or meeting friends for coffee. Streetwear-inspired silhouettes with a retro aesthetic are especially popular this season, but stick to classic white trainers for a timeless look, or experiment with new designs for something trendier. For a sport-luxe twist, pair your trainers with cropped, raw-hem jeans and an oversized coat.Shop Trainers: NEW BALANCE 990V4 Leather-Trimmed Suede and Mesh Sneakers The fashion crowd's current favourite "dad" sneaker. VEJA + Net Sustain Campo Leather and Suede Sneakers Sustainable and stylish with just the right amount of retro flair. 3. Kitten HeelsStyle Notes: Fashion fully embraced kitten heels last year, and it's easy to see why. They're the perfect balance of chic and comfort, making them ideal for when you want to elevate your look without committing to towering stilettos. Cropped jeans allow the dainty heel to take centre stage—the ideal shoe solution for a smart-casual evening outfit. Pair yours with cropped straight-leg jeans and a tucked-in blouse for an office-appropriate look. On weekends, try them with a graphic tee and a statement belt for a cool-girl edge.Shop Kitten Heels: ZARA Buckle Slingback Shoes Affordable elegance for any occasion. Jimmy Choo Scarlett 50 Leather Pumps A luxe option that's worth the investment. ARKET Heeled Leather Mules These sculptural heels look so much more expensive than they are. & Other Stories Pointed Slingback Pumps Sleek and versatile for everyday wear. 4. LoafersStyle Notes: Loafers have been so popular of late, and I put it down to their ability to be styled in so many ways. Whether you prefer chunky soles or sleek, slim designs, they add a polished finish to cropped jeans without feeling overly formal. Choose platform loafers for an edgy twist or stick with classic penny loafers for a more timeless vibe. I love wearing mine with cropped wide-leg jeans and a cosy knit for a relaxed yet refined feel.Shop Loafers: G.H Bass Weejuns Penny Loafers G.H.Bass loafers are a must in any fashion lover's wardrobe. Gucci Women's Loafer With Horsebit It's hard to believe these aren't designer, and they look so comfy. I love the elongated almost-almond toe on this pair. 5. Pointed-Toe Court ShoesStyle Notes: No shoe style embodies chic quite like pointed-toe court shoes. Whether you opt for a bold colour or a sleek neutral, tall heels elevate cropped jeans in a way that feels both timeless and fashion-forward. Match a vibrant pair with dark-wash jeans for a pop of colour, or go monochrome with nude, black or deep-hued pumps for a more streamlined look. Finish with a tailored blazer for a sophisticated outfit.Shop Pointed-Toe Court Shoes: MANOLO BLAHNIK BB 90 Leather Pumps A forever classic and another pair loved by fashion's favourite fictional character, Carrie Bradshaw. ZARA Crackled Effect Heels The crackle finish adds a point of difference. YSL Opyum Pumps in Patent Leather STUART WEITZMAN Rosie D'orsay Appliquéd Leather Point-Toe Pumps I love the white appliqué detail. It blends into the shoe but adds a little something extra. 6. Ankle BootsStyle Notes: Boots with cropped jeans is a no-brainer, especially when transitioning between seasons. Whether you wear sleek sock boots for a streamlined finish, or chunky combat boots for a tougher edge, cropped jeans let your boots do the talking. For a classic look, style slim-fitting ankle boots with a straight-leg pair and a wool coat, or if you're going for something more casual, opt for thick-soled lace-ups or Chelsea boots and a leather jacket.Shop Ankle Boots: KHAITE Arizona Leather Ankle Boots Super sleek and super versatile. Dr. Martens 1460 Pascal Bex Boots Iconic and edgy, classic Dr. Martens look so cool when styled with cropped jeans, and they'll last you years. COS Square-Toe Leather Ankle Boots These kitten-heel boots will take you from day to night with ease. The Row Zipped Boot I in Leather Certainly not cheap, but so good.
html:
If there's one denim trend that seems to defy the seasonal shuffle, it's cropped jeans.

Whether an ankle-grazing skinny cut or a wide-leg silhouette that hovers just above the ankle, this wardrobe staple has earned a permanent spot in the fashion set's rotation. As someone who lives in cropped jeans year-round—switching between lighter washes for summer and raw hems for winter—I've come to realise that the right pair of shoes can make or break the look.

The perfect shoe not only completes an outfit but sets the tone—no matter if you're aiming for effortless French-girl style or laid-back cool. And with runway shows continuing to serve us impeccable denim and shoe combinations, now feels like the right time to share which shoes truly complement cropped jeans best.

Take, for example, The Row's autumn/winter 2024 show, where minimalist ballet flats were styled with slightly flared cropped denim. The juxtaposition of the typically "feminine" flat with the casual feel of cropped jeans was a standout moment that inspired me to rethink how I style my cropped jeans. Whilst I lean towards trainers for a more off-duty vibe, my fellow editors are devoted to the timeless appeal of loafers—especially when paired with cropped straight-leg jeans. From kitten heels at Miu Miu to classic pumps à la Carrie Bradshaw, certain footwear works beautifully with this hemline.

Beyond aesthetics, there's also a practical element at play. Cropped jeans, by nature, frame the ankle, making them the perfect canvas for shoes that command attention. Whether you prefer sleek, polished options or something more laid-back and streetwear-inspired, the key is balance. Each shoe style lends itself to different styling possibilities; chinky trainers add a bit of an edge whilst a low heel imparts elegance.

Below, I've rounded up six key shoe styles that work well with cropped jeans. There are both designer and high-street options, so there's something for everyone. You'll never have to stress over which shoes to wear with your cropped jeans again.

Shop My Favourite Shoes to Wear With Cropped Jeans:

1. Ballet Flats

Style Notes: Few shoe trends have experienced as much of a revival recently as ballet flats. Thanks to fashion's obsession with quiet luxury, ballet flats are everywhere—from the streets of Paris to the Instagram feeds of the most stylish editors. Their dainty profile pairs beautifully with cropped jeans, offering a delicate touch that balances out the denim's more casual feel. Opt for pointed-toe styles for a more elevated vibe, or stick with classic round-toe versions for a true Parisian aesthetic. To avoid looking too prim, I love pairing mine with slightly distressed or frayed-hem jeans. Throw on a boxy blazer, and you're good to go.

Shop Ballet Flats:

The Row

Awar Ballerina Flat in Leather

Sleek and minimalist with a touch of elegance.

Reformation

Bethany Ballet Flat

These popular flats are known for their comfort and timeless appeal.

LE MONDE BERYL

Suede Mary Jane Ballet Flats

For a truly French flat, look to Le Monde Beryl.

Arket

Leather Ballet Flats

A simple pair with a pretty twist.

2. Trainers

Style Notes: When it comes to casual style, trainers are my go-to with cropped jeans. They add a cool, effortless feel and work well whether you're running errands or meeting friends for coffee. Streetwear-inspired silhouettes with a retro aesthetic are especially popular this season, but stick to classic white trainers for a timeless look, or experiment with new designs for something trendier. For a sport-luxe twist, pair your trainers with cropped, raw-hem jeans and an oversized coat.

Shop Trainers:

NEW BALANCE

990V4 Leather-Trimmed Suede and Mesh Sneakers

The fashion crowd's current favourite "dad" sneaker.

VEJA

+ Net Sustain Campo Leather and Suede Sneakers

Sustainable and stylish with just the right amount of retro flair.

3. Kitten Heels

Style Notes: Fashion fully embraced kitten heels last year, and it's easy to see why. They're the perfect balance of chic and comfort, making them ideal for when you want to elevate your look without committing to towering stilettos. Cropped jeans allow the dainty heel to take centre stage—the ideal shoe solution for a smart-casual evening outfit. Pair yours with cropped straight-leg jeans and a tucked-in blouse for an office-appropriate look. On weekends, try them with a graphic tee and a statement belt for a cool-girl edge.

Shop Kitten Heels:

ZARA

Buckle Slingback Shoes

Affordable elegance for any occasion.

Jimmy Choo

Scarlett 50 Leather Pumps

A luxe option that's worth the investment.

ARKET

Heeled Leather Mules

These sculptural heels look so much more expensive than they are.

& Other Stories

Pointed Slingback Pumps

Sleek and versatile for everyday wear.

4. Loafers

Style Notes: Loafers have been so popular of late, and I put it down to their ability to be styled in so many ways. Whether you prefer chunky soles or sleek, slim designs, they add a polished finish to cropped jeans without feeling overly formal. Choose platform loafers for an edgy twist or stick with classic penny loafers for a more timeless vibe. I love wearing mine with cropped wide-leg jeans and a cosy knit for a relaxed yet refined feel.

Shop Loafers:

G.H Bass

Weejuns Penny Loafers

G.H.Bass loafers are a must in any fashion lover's wardrobe.

Gucci

Women's Loafer With Horsebit

It's hard to believe these aren't designer, and they look so comfy.

I love the elongated almost-almond toe on this pair.

5. Pointed-Toe Court Shoes

Style Notes: No shoe style embodies chic quite like pointed-toe court shoes. Whether you opt for a bold colour or a sleek neutral, tall heels elevate cropped jeans in a way that feels both timeless and fashion-forward. Match a vibrant pair with dark-wash jeans for a pop of colour, or go monochrome with nude, black or deep-hued pumps for a more streamlined look. Finish with a tailored blazer for a sophisticated outfit.

Shop Pointed-Toe Court Shoes:

MANOLO BLAHNIK

BB 90 Leather Pumps

A forever classic and another pair loved by fashion's favourite fictional character, Carrie Bradshaw.

ZARA

Crackled Effect Heels

The crackle finish adds a point of difference.

YSL

Opyum Pumps in Patent Leather

STUART WEITZMAN

Rosie D'orsay Appliquéd Leather Point-Toe Pumps

I love the white appliqué detail. It blends into the shoe but adds a little something extra.

6. Ankle Boots

Style Notes: Boots with cropped jeans is a no-brainer, especially when transitioning between seasons. Whether you wear sleek sock boots for a streamlined finish, or chunky combat boots for a tougher edge, cropped jeans let your boots do the talking. For a classic look, style slim-fitting ankle boots with a straight-leg pair and a wool coat, or if you're going for something more casual, opt for thick-soled lace-ups or Chelsea boots and a leather jacket.

Shop Ankle Boots:

KHAITE

Arizona Leather Ankle Boots

Super sleek and super versatile.

Dr. Martens

1460 Pascal Bex Boots

Iconic and edgy, classic Dr. Martens look so cool when styled with cropped jeans, and they'll last you years.

COS

Square-Toe Leather Ankle Boots

These kitten-heel boots will take you from day to night with ease.

The Row

Zipped Boot I in Leather

Certainly not cheap, but so good.
